questiontext.text:
Exercise

Evaluate the following double integral.

\(I=\displaystyle\int_{@aa@}^{@bb@}\displaystyle\int_{@cc@}^{@dd@}\left( x^{2}+y^{2}\right) \, \mathrm{d}x\mathrm{d}y\)

\(I=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

If your answer is not an integer, leave it in rational form e.g. 23/5.

generalfeedback.text:
The integration takes place over the rectangle shown below.

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [{#xmin#}, {#ymax#}, {#xmax#}, {#ymin#}], keepaspectratio: true, axis: true, showCopyright: false, showNavigation: false, grid: false }); // Hide tick labels and ticks on x-axis but label it board.defaultAxes.x.setAttribute({ ticks: { drawLabels: false, // hide numbers majorHeight: 0, minorHeight: 0 }, name: 'x', withLabel: true, label: { position: 'rt', offset: [1, -10] } }); // Hide tick labels and ticks on y-axis but label it board.defaultAxes.y.setAttribute({ ticks: { drawLabels: false, majorHeight: 0, minorHeight: 0 }, name: 'y', withLabel: true, label: { position: 'rt', offset: [-15, 0] } }); // points var bl = board.create('point', [{#cc#},{#aa#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}); var br = board.create('point', [{#dd#},{#aa#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}) var tr = board.create('point', [{#dd#},{#bb#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}); var tl = board.create('point', [{#cc#},{#bb#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}); var rectangle = board.create('polygon', [bl, br, tr, tl],{name:"Rectangle",withLabel:false, color: 'white'}); // Set all edges (borders) to dark blue rectangle.borders.forEach(line => { line.setAttribute({strokeColor: 'darkblue'}); }); // Label coordinates dynamically [bl, br, tr, tl].forEach((pt) => { board.create('text', [ () => pt.X() + 0.1, () => pt.Y() + 0.1, () => `(${pt.X()}, ${pt.Y()})` ], { fontSize: 12, fixed: true, highlight: false }); }); [[/jsxgraph]]

We have
\(\qquad \displaystyle\int_{@aa@}^{@bb@}\displaystyle \int_{@cc@}^{@dd@}\left( x^{2}+y^{2}\right) \, \mathrm{d}x \mathrm{d}y\)

Computing the inner integral, we get
\(\qquad \displaystyle \int_{@cc@}^{@dd@}\left( x^{2}+y^{2}\right) \, \mathrm{d}x\)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = \left[\dfrac{x^3}{3} + xy^2\right]_{@cc@}^{@dd@} \)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = {@(dd)^3/3 + (dd)*y^2@} - ({@(cc)^3/3 + cc*y^2@}) \)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = {@(dd)^3/3 + (dd)*y^2 - ((cc)^3/3 + cc*y^2)@} \)

This can then be put into the outer integral to give
\(\qquad \displaystyle \int_{@aa@}^{@bb@} \left({@ff@}\right) \, \mathrm{d}y\)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = \left[{@ee*y - gg*y@} + \dfrac{{@y^3*(dd-cc)@}}{3} \right]_{@aa@}^{@bb@} \)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = {@ev(ee*bb - gg*bb,simp) + ev(bb^3*(dd-cc)/3,simp), simp=false@} - ({@ev(ee*aa - gg*aa, simp) + ev(aa^3*(dd-cc)/3,simp), simp=false@})\)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = {@ta1@}\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

qtest.description: Test case assuming the teacher's input gets full marks.
